intro: Uncaria africana var. africana, commonly known as the African climbing shrub, is a woody vine native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its twining stems and dense foliage. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers followed by red, fleshy berries. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a rough texture. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
